common_failures.cause: Object not properly stabilized or surface is slippery
common_failures.resolution: Use a non-slip cutting board or stabilize the object with a fork or claw grip.
Apply steady pressure and use a guided motion or a cutting tool with adjustable guides.

common_failures.cause: Tool not maintained or used improperly
common_failures.resolution: Sharpen the tool regularly and avoid cutting hard, non-intended materials.

common_failures.cause: Improper grip or lack of attention
common_failures.resolution: Use proper cutting techniques, such as the claw grip, and keep fingers clear of the blade.

common_failures.cause: Using the wrong tool for the object or applying excessive force
common_failures.resolution: Select an appropriate tool for the material and ensure the tool is in good condition before use.

common_failures.cause: Insufficient force applied or wrong cutting angle
common_failures.resolution: Adjust the cutting angle and apply consistent force.

common_failures.cause: Cutting through the object onto the surface
common_failures.resolution: Use a cutting board or protective layer beneath the object.
Use a sharp tool suitable for the material and cut in a single, smooth motion.

common_failures.failure: Cuts are not to the desired size or shape
common_failures.resolution: Measure and mark the object before cutting, or use a template for guidance.

common_failures.failure: Difficulty in cutting through tough materials
common_failures.resolution: Use a heavier-duty cutting tool or pre-score the material to make cutting easier.
